sub_title: Technical Consultant for the Color Industry
summary:
Eager and experienced technology manager, fascinated by the processing of Color and coatings. 

• gained experience over the last 25 years in Color processing, Chemistry (coatings), Color-IT, Marketing, Education and Management;
• developed a wide skill set to communicate easily with all different disciplines resulting in quick, practical & useful solutions for the stakeholders involved;
• is always eager to learn and able to pick up quickly new information resulting in good focus;
• successfully led departments and projects.

Specialties: Business management experience in Color Research and Marketing 

• Having expert knowledge in Color, its scientific background and IT relations
• Works confidently in cross functional (& cultural) teams
• Handles efficiently in complex and quick changing environments
• People manager, coach and trainer
• Analyzes problems and create solutions effectively with customer and business focus
• Strong in program and project management
• Good leadership, interpersonal effectiveness (influencing & inspiring), process and time management skills

profile_positions.description:
Color technologie is my passion, or more precise; to help and assist people producing their colored products correct, fast, accurate and consistent. Together with my compagnon Roel Gottenbos we offer our many years of field expertise as "Color Technology Consultancy" (CTC). 

 CTC’s fields of Color Expertise;
 ▪ Quality control, Data communication, Process efficiency and Innovations
 ▪ Optimization of Industrialized color processes from start to customer offerings
 ▪ Color and coatings application technologies for solids, metallics, pearlescents, translucents, variable gloss and surface textures
 ▪ Solutions for digital color communication and data sharing for B2B and B2C 
 ▪ Use of color hardware (spectro’s D8-0/45/MA, color retrievers, viewing boxes, gloss) and software
 ▪ Color in relation to modelling, statistics, evaluation, validation, testing, management, coaching and training
 ▪ Color psychophysics to correlate human visual interpretations with measurement data
 ▪ Interim management color research groups and dedicated in house trainings
 ▪ All fields of industries like Automotive, Decorative, Wood, Coil finishes, Extrusion, Specialty coatings, Aerospace, Powder coatings and Marine

 CTC’s Field of operation;
 ▪ Producers of coatings, plastics, inks, pigments and other colored materials
 ▪ Application areas like food, pharmaceuticals, printing, cosmetics, fashion, construction and architectures
 ▪ Producers of color equipment, software, data solutions and services
 ▪ Both national as International
 ▪ From small projects (8 hours) up to large assignments (max 30% of capacity)
profile_positions.title: Owner and technical consultant for the Color Industry

profile_positions.description: I have been appointed in this job to harmonize and rationalize the technical color functions with respect to hardware, software, databases and procedures within the business area of Industrial Coatings. From origin these Industrial businesses (Coil Coatings, Packaging coatings and Wood Finishes) offer colored paint products as B-to-B to local customers. Each laboratory and production site developed its own assortment, utelizing a wide range of tools, instruments and practices. AkzoNobel wants to align its assortment and supporting technology to grow to global leadership in industrial coatings.
profile_positions.title: Global Color Manager Industrial Coatings

profile_positions.description: AkzoNobels's Industrial Coatings (Wood Finishes and Adhesives, Packaging and Coil Coatings) is a conglomerate of many sites over the globe in which color matching and QC procedures developed organically over time. In order to reduce complexity, to gain more out of sharing data and expertise, plus for having common use and easy cross overs of succesfull products, the BU wants to align the color processes by standardization of color tools (hardware, software, practices and processes). My role is to organize and coordinate this harmonization process.
profile_positions.title: Manager Color tools

profile_positions.description:
At changing my position and stepping up to the next level, I got a couple of months in which I was offered a job running a huge construction project. Not to actually manage the construction activities themselves, but to organize all activities on behalf of the eventual homesteader AkzoNobel Decorative Paints. 
For this investment of almost 7M Euro I lead and collaborated with a broad team of specialists like purchasing, finance and controling, enginering, publicity, HSE as well as representatives of the future "inhabitants"​, local management, the constructor and the steering committee. 
I was pleased and felt very honnored with this role as it offered me lots of experience in an entire new area of expertise. The culture, language and people's interactions in this enginering-wold were quite different from my originally worlds of Research, Development, Production and Marketing which made this job a great learnful experience. The project was by all means a huge success as it was finalized in time, well within budget and the inhabitants were excited with their new work environment!
profile_positions.title: Project Manager Construction new Laboratory

profile_positions.description: I lead a group of color experts (10+) doing colorimetric research, kept our global color recipe database in good shape (40.000 customers), supported our business with accurate color masters for our fan decks and developed IT programs for accurate and fast color recipe developments, QC and our point of sale mixing machine system. Our work offerred our Decorative business in all global markets with a wide variety of accurate colored products, instruments and tools.
profile_positions.title: Color Research Manager

profile_positions.description: In this job I managed a team which was responsible for the development and support of point of sale software, the database and distribution of color recipe data to over 30.000 Decorative end users world wide, the quality control on collateral and fandecks and offering color technology to all AkzoNobel's Deco brands.
profile_positions.title: International marketing manager

profile_positions.description: In this role I lead a team of database and IT specialists to generate and improve color technology services for the global Decorative market. I managed a wide range of projects on color instrumentation, developing a color atlas (6000 colors), data conversion tools. All tools were meant to be used by end-users (professional painters and shop owners) and provided an innovative edge to the business units marketing success.
profile_positions.title: technical marketing manager Color Decorative Paints

profile_positions.description: In the Car Refinishes Technology Center for Colorimetry I have been managing a Color IT system (Mascot) that was in use by Manufacturing, Marketing and Research. This system was also in use by Aerospace finishes and Industrial Coatings. Next to Managing the different installations, I also handled Color Education and Training as well coordinated specific projects also with Powder Coatings, Marine & Protective Coatings and Decorative Coatings.
profile_positions.title: International Color Research Liason

profile_positions.description: This job I have done shortly after the birth of our twins. Doing Color research could well be combined in a four-days-a-week job with the one caring for my kids at home. I got a number of very interesting (color-) studies and (color-)projects and got skilled in colorimetry. These studies and projects involved product, efficiency and QC improvements all in hardware, software and procedures in manufacturing, marketing and research.
profile_positions.title: Color Research engineer

company.name: Dutch society for study of Color (NVvK)

profile_positions.description: The Dutch society for study on Color, or "Nederlandse Vereniging voor Kleurenstudie (NVvK)" is a community of over 500 members with variable professional backgrounds but all with specific interest in Color like designers, artists, architects and scientists.  During the period I chaired the community grew with an extra 40 % members, More than 10 Color congresses were organized, we got a central office in Utrecht, the administration got automated and many the presentation was updated.
